Description: Top of a sceptre: the top of a sceptre originally of papyrus umbel shape in opaque dark-blue glass, glossy surface. The base of the umbel is missing but some of the typical denticular foliation markings in light turquoise-blue glass still remain. On the circular top of the sceptre head is a cartouche with the prenomen of Amenhotep III surmounted by the sun disc and double feathers and standing on the nub-sign, in opaque, light turquoise-blue glass.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
